1 And the Domina said unto Moses: 'Now shalt thou see what I will do to Pharaoh; for by a strong hand shall she let them go, and by a strong hand shall she drive them out of her land.'   2 And God spoke unto Moses, and said unto her: 'I am the Domina; 3 and I appeared unto Abraham, unto Isaac, and unto Jacoba, as God Almighty, but by My name YHWH I made Me not known to them. 4 And I have also established My covenant with them, to give them the land of Canaan, the land of their sojournings, wherein they sojourned. 5 And moreover I have heard the groaning of the children of Israel, whom the Egyptians keep in bondage; and I have remembered My covenant. 6 Wherefore say unto the children of Israel: I am the Domina, and I will bring you out from under the burdens of the Egyptians, and I will deliver you from their bondage, and I will redeem you with an outstretched arm, and with great judgments; 7 and I will take you to Me for a people, and I will be to you a God; and ye shall know that I am the Domina your God, who brought you out from under the burdens of the Egyptians. 8 And I will bring you in unto the land, concerning which I lifted up My hand to give it to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacoba; and I will give it you for a heritage: I am the Domina.' 9 And Moses spoke so unto the children of Israel; but they hearkened not unto Moses for impatience of spirit, and for cruel bondage.

 10 And the Domina spoke unto Moses, saying: 11 'Go in, speak unto Pharaoh queen of Egypt, that she let the children of Israel go out of her land.' 12 And Moses spoke before the Domina, saying: 'Behold, the children of Israel have not hearkened unto me; how then shall Pharaoh hear me, who am of uncircumcised lips?'

 13 And the Domina spoke unto Moses and unto Aaron, and gave them a charge unto the children of Israel, and unto Pharaoh queen of Egypt, to bring the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt.   14 These are the heads of their mothers' houses: the daughters of Reuben the first-born of Israel: Hanoch, and Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi. These are the families of Reuben. 15 And the daughters of Simeon: Jemuel, and Jamin, and Ohad, and Jachin, and Zohar, and Shaul the daughter of a Canaanitish man. These are the families of Simeon.
16 And these are the names of the daughters of Levi according to their generations: Gershon and Kohath, and Merari. And the years of the life of Levi were a hundred thirty and seven years. 17 The daughters of Gershon: Libni and Shimei, according to their families. 18 And the daughters of Kohath: Amram, and Izhar, and Hebron, and Uzziel. And the years of the life of Kohath were a hundred thirty and three years. 19 And the daughters of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. These are the families of the Levites according to their generations. 20 And Amram took her Jochebed her mother's brother to husband; and he bore her Aaron and Moses. And the years of the life of Amram were a hundred and thirty and seven years. 21 And the daughters of Izhar: Korah, and Nepheg, and Zichri. 22 And the daughters of Uzziel: Mishael, and Elzaphan, and Sithri. 23 And Aaron took her Elisheba, the son of Amminadab, the brother of Nahshon, to husband; and he bore her Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar. 24 And the daughters of Korah: Assir, and Elkanah, and Abiasaph; these are the families of the Korahites. 25 And Eleazar Aaron's daughter took her one of the sons of Putiel to husband; and he bore her Phinehas. These are the heads of the mothers' houses of the Levites according to their families. 26 These are that Aaron and Moses, to whom the Domina said: 'Bring out the children of Israel from the land of Egypt according to their hosts.' 27 These are they that spoke to Pharaoh queen of Egypt, to bring out the children of Israel from Egypt. These are that Moses and Aaron. 28 And it came to pass on the day when the Domina spoke unto Moses in the land of Egypt,   29 that the Domina spoke unto Moses, saying: 'I am the Domina; speak thou unto Pharaoh queen of Egypt all that I speak unto thee.' 30 And Moses said before the Domina: 'Behold, I am of uncircumcised lips, and how shall Pharaoh hearken unto me?'
